001package edu.pdx.cs410J.apptbookweb;
002
003import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
004
005import java.io.PrintWriter;
006import java.io.StringWriter;
007import java.util.HashMap;
008import java.util.Map;
009
010import static org.hamcrest.MatcherAssert.assertThat;
011import static org.hamcrest.Matchers.*;
012
013class MessagesTest {
014
015  @Test
016  void malformedWordAndDefinitionReturnsNull() {
017    assertThat(Messages.parseDictionaryEntry("blah"), nullValue());
018  }
019
020  @Test
021  void canParseFormattedDictionaryEntryPair() {
022    String word = "testWord";
023    String definition = "testDefinition";
024    String formatted = Messages.formatDictionaryEntry(word, definition);
025    Map.Entry<String, String> parsed = Messages.parseDictionaryEntry(formatted);
026    assertThat(parsed, notNullValue());
027    assertThat(parsed.getKey(), equalTo(word));
028    assertThat(parsed.getValue(), equalTo(definition));
029  }
030
031  @Test
032  void canParseFormattedDictionaryEntryWithoutLeadingSpaces() {
033    String word = "testWord";
034    String definition = "testDefinition";
035    String formatted = Messages.formatDictionaryEntry(word, definition);
036    String trimmed = formatted.trim();
037    Map.Entry<String, String> parsed = Messages.parseDictionaryEntry(trimmed);
038    assertThat(parsed, notNullValue());
039    assertThat(parsed.getKey(), equalTo(word));
040    assertThat(parsed.getValue(), equalTo(definition));
041
042  }
043
044  @Test
045  void nullDefinitionIsParsedAsNull() {
046    String word = "testWord";
047    String formatted = Messages.formatDictionaryEntry(word, null);
048    Map.Entry<String, String> parsed = Messages.parseDictionaryEntry(formatted);
049    assertThat(parsed, notNullValue());
050    assertThat(parsed.getKey(), equalTo(word));
051    assertThat(parsed.getValue(), equalTo(null));
052  }
053
054  @Test
055  void canParseFormattedDictionary() {
056    Map<String, String> dictionary = new HashMap<>();
057
058    for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
059      String word = String.valueOf(i);
060      String definition = "QQ" + word;
061      dictionary.put(word, definition);
062    }
063
064    StringWriter sw = new StringWriter();
065    Messages.formatDictionaryEntries(new PrintWriter(sw, true), dictionary);
066
067    String formatted = sw.toString();
068
069    Map<String, String> actual = Messages.parseDictionary(formatted);
070    assertThat(actual, equalTo(dictionary));
071  }
072}
